title: A forum to keep it real in?
body:
Hello yall. 


So I bet its going to be a no...but thats the worse yall can say if i ask so here we go.

Is it possible for us to get a forum..Where you can go to, and when people ask stuff like...

 "Why did i get banned....i only called someone a ......"

And we can respond with...

"look asshole, you cant run around telling people that they need to off themselfs becouse they are a ......."


You know a place WHERE PEOPLE KNOW....IF YOU POST...you will get rosted harder then Trump at a liberal rally? and you know it....so when people give you flat blunt ass honesty....YOU KNEW IT WAS COMMING. 

I know, Probably not, but I had to ask.


Have a blessed day yall!

replies.body:
In short, no.

The Universal Rules prohibit insulting others, so no, even if someone's being toxic/negative or what have you in their chat logs, that doesn't give others the right to insult or belittle others.

In the Player Behavior sub-forum, we're more strict because we realize that players go to that forum seeking help or advice on their punishments. Responding to toxicity with more toxicity isn't helpful, and won't inspire someone to change their behavior.
What does keeping it real have to do with insulting people? Like, why do you need to call someone an asshole to say "telling people to kill themselves is bad."?

Growing up my father always taught me to talk to my audience.  If you are speaking to a room full of scholars, then you refrain from using a tone that made you come of as belittling the intelligence of others. While also knowing that if your dealing with a bunch of drunks who love to cuss and fight....you make your point while punching them in the face and using expressions that even they could understand. 


While I can do both, 

If your coming to a forum with the legitement question as to why you got banned for calling someone "A flying fucking moron who could not fuck his way in to a condom" - forget who posted that jewel of a line. Then me telling you that what you said was incensitive to the feelings of others, will instantly have the person yelling and scream about look at this safespace mf here....When if they posted in the section that you could respond in kind to the post...that has this language and wont get removed....can go hey dipshit you cant say flying fucking moron who could not fuck his way into a condom....are you retarted....read that back if someone said that to you would you laugh or wanna skull f their face...if its the 2nd maybe you should nto say something like that...as it will get you banned. With out it being removed. 

It would be a forum that you could visit, but not see like the rants.

While I understand the forum rules.... You dont teach a blind person a language, using sign lauguage.

Except you aren't talking to your audience then. Meeting aggression with aggression isn't the best approach in most situations, especially when one person is at an elevated level of tension from a recent punishment.

Ideally you need to speak in a calming tone, but not cross the line to patronizing. This is already a tough thing to do in many cases, partly due to the fact that text doesn't really have a tone. People will read and think whatever tone they want to hear.

So again, you don't need to match aggression with aggression just to "keep it real".

Yep, yay **smart** phones!

> Growing up my father always taught me to talk to my audience. If you are speaking to a room full of scholars, then you refrain from using a tone that made you come of as belittling the intelligence of others. While also knowing that if your dealing with a bunch of drunks who love to cuss and fight....you make your point while punching them in the face and using expressions that even they could understand.

If you have to accentuate your point by punching someone, then either you're dealing with the wrong people, or you've screwed up terribly in the conversation department.

At any rate, look at it like this; since you're plainly referring to PB, look at PB like a place to *teach* people better behavior. Emphasis on the word "teach".

You don't teach people by insulting them, belittling them, etc., you teach them through patience. Explain what they did wrong, what they should do going forward, and don't insult them.

Because insulting someone is a surefire way to get them to double-down, go on the defensive, and learn exactly _nothing_.

> You dont teach a blind person a language, using sign lauguage.

This is probably the strangest non-sequitur I've seen yet.

Here's a more appropriate phrase; "_You catch more flies with honey than you can with vinegar._" You won't find people readily accepting your points or learning anything if you embitter them with insults.
I don't think Boards will ever have a section where it's okay to "rost" people.
You can be real in this forum. It is all about how you word it.

Actually you can try making such threads at 4Chan.org/b/. You can keep it as real as you want over there because there's no PC bullshit on that site. One of the best sites on the internet to be honest.
